normalized_lines: 1 1/2 lb salmon fillet, cut into 4 pieces
Preheat oven to 425°F and line a sheet pan with parchment.
Whisk glaze ingredients in a bowl until smooth.
Pat salmon dry, rub with oil, salt, and pepper, then brush with half the glaze.
Brush with remaining glaze and roast 6 to 8 minutes more, until flaky.
Serve over rice with cucumber, scallions, and sesame seeds.
Note: If your gochujang is very spicy, reduce to 1 tablespoon.
Nutrition is estimated and will vary.
Affiliate disclosure: this post may contain affiliate links.

target_recipe.title: Sheet Pan Gochujang Salmon Bowls
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb salmon fillet, cut into 4 pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F and line a sheet pan with parchment.
Whisk glaze ingredients in a bowl until smooth.
Pat salmon dry, rub with oil, salt, and pepper, then brush with half the glaze.
Brush with remaining glaze and roast 6 to 8 minutes more, until flaky.
Serve over rice with cucumber, scallions, and sesame seeds.
notes: Note: If your gochujang is very spicy, reduce to 1 tablespoon.
